p: An indication that evolution at the population scale does not merely represent a continuation of directional within-host evolution, with repeated bottlenecks at the point of transmission, is the observation that HIV-1 evolves about two to six times faster within hosts than at the population scale [ 5– 8] for both synonymous and nonsynonymous mutations [ 9– 11]. Although here we examined different subtypes and gene regions to previous studies, our analysis confirms a similar mismatch in evolutionary rates.
